sentence: 1. Why did the lion win the race? because he mufasa.
2. What did the lion win the race? because he mufasa.

These jokes have the word mufasa, which can refer to the character in The Lion King and also serves as a pun for mufasa sounding like muff (a colloquial term that can refer to a type of ear muff or a slang word associated with incompetence).
Why did the lion win the race? because he mufasa.
explanation: mufasa is referenced as a character in The Lion King and has a pun-like alternate meaning in slang.
first_new_sentence: In The Lion King, Mufasa is a wise and noble lion who teaches his son about the circle of life.
second_new_sentence: Some people may associate the term mufasa with a playful or inept context, sometimes referring to someone who lacks skill or sureness.

sentence: None of the other jokes meet both criteria of having the same word take on two meanings in the given context while still being a single valid dictionary word, so only this entry is provided.
